Hush money case: US judge sentences Donald Trump, declines to impose jail term, fine - Hindustan Times
summary:
Donald Trump Sentenced in Hush Money Case

Date: January 10, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

A US judge sentenced President-elect Donald Trump over a criminal conviction related to hush money paid to a porn star. The verdict marks the first felony conviction for a US president, but Trump will not face jail or a fine.

  • The judge imposed the mildest criminal sanction available: an unconditional discharge.
  • Judge Juan M Merchan cited unique circumstances surrounding the case.
  • Trump was convicted on 34 counts of falsifying business records.
  • He claims the conviction is intended to sabotage his presidential campaign.
"Never before has this court been presented with such a unique and remarkable set of circumstances." - Judge Juan M Merchan

The case revolves around a payment of $130,000 to Stormy Daniels, made to suppress disclosure about an alleged encounter during Trump's 2016 campaign. Trump denied the encounter and claimed the verdict was politically motivated.
newTitle: Donald Trump Sentenced in Hush Money Case but Avoids Jail Time

title: Samsung Galaxy S25 series full specs leaked ahead of January 22 Unpacked event: Details - The Financial Express
summary:
Samsung Galaxy S25 Series Full Specs Leaked Ahead of January 22 Unpacked Event

Publication Date: January 15, 2024

Source: Financial Express

The Galaxy S25 series is set for launch soon, and leaks reveal detailed specifications for the Galaxy S25, Galaxy S25+, and Galaxy S25 Ultra models, including their display, performance, and camera features.

Key Points

  • The Galaxy S25 features a 6.2-inch Dynamic AMOLED 2X display with Full HD+ (2340 x 1080) resolution and a 120Hz refresh rate.
  • It is powered by the Snapdragon 8 Elite for Galaxy chipset with 12GB of RAM and storage options of 128GB, 256GB, and 512GB.
  • Camera setup includes a 50MP primary, 12MP ultrawide, and 10MP telephoto lens with OIS.
  • Battery capacity stands at 4,000mAh with 25W wired fast charging and wireless charging support.
  • The Galaxy S25+ has a larger screen at 6.7 inches, WQHD resolution, a bigger 4,900mAh battery, and similar camera specifications.
  • The flagship Galaxy S25 Ultra includes a 6.9-inch display, advanced 200MP camera, and a capacity of up to 1TB storage.

Notable Quotes or Statistics

The S25 Ultra model features the highest level of detail and color accuracy with its massive 6.9-inch display and exceptional camera capabilities.

The phone runs on Android 15 with Samsung’s One UI 7 for a user-friendly experience.
newTitle: Samsung Galaxy S25 Series Specs Leaked Ahead of Unpacked Event

title: Third HMPV case reported from Ahmedabad, state tally reaches four - Gujarat Samachar
summary:
Third HMPV Case Reported in Ahmedabad, Tally Reaches Four in Gujarat

Publication Date: Friday | Source: Gujarat Samachar

A new HMPV case has been reported from Ahmedabad, bringing the state's total to four cases. This incident marks the third reported case from Ahmedabad.

  • The latest patient is a nine-month-old infant transferred from Viha Children’s Hospital to Childhood Hospital.
  • The previous case involved an 80-year-old man who tested positive and was admitted to Sterling Hospital.
  • Three cases of HMPV have been confirmed in Ahmedabad and one in Prantij.
  • HMPV is a respiratory virus that tends to peak in winter, particularly affecting young children and the elderly.
  • Advisory issued by the state urges citizens to follow health guidelines to combat respiratory infections.
“Metapneumovirus (HMPV) is similar to other respiratory viruses, and it's crucial to maintain hygiene and avoid crowded places to prevent infection.”

Citizens are advised to cover their mouths when sneezing, wash hands regularly, and seek medical attention if they exhibit respiratory symptoms.
newTitle: Third HMPV Case Reported in Ahmedabad, Tally Reaches Four in Gujarat

title: 6 Very Beautiful Images Of Moon Taken By NASA - Times Now
summary:
6 Very Beautiful Images Of Moon Taken By NASA

Publication Date: January 10, 2025, Source: Times Now

This article showcases six breathtaking images of the Moon captured by NASA, highlighting the beauty and intrigue of Earth's natural satellite.

  • 2017 Total Solar Eclipse image showing the Sun's corona.
  • Full Moon photo taken from the International Space Station.
  • Unique perspective of the Moon by NASA's MESSENGER spacecraft.
  • Tycho Crater captured by the Hubble Space Telescope.
  • Oblique view of the Copernicus crater taken by Lunar Orbiter 2.
  • Image of the Moon captured by NASA’s Galileo spacecraft in 1992.
“These images aid in understanding the physics and structure of the Moon, showcasing its beauty and our capabilities of capturing it from various spaces.”

This collection of images not only emphasizes the aesthetic appeal of the Moon but also engages audiences in lunar exploration and science.
newTitle: Stunning NASA Images of the Moon

India Women (IND-W) defeated Ireland Women (IRE-W) by 6 wickets in the first ODI of the series. The match showcased notable performances from both teams, with Ireland's captain Gaby Lewis scoring 92 runs and IND-W's Pratika Rawal being named Player of the Match for her batting excellence.

title: When Salim Khan revealed why marital bliss has always evaded Salman Khan - Hindustan Times
summary:
Salim Khan Explains Why Salman Khan Remains Single

Date: January 10, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

In a candid revelation, Salim Khan shared insights into why his son, Salman Khan, has never married, despite being one of Bollywood's most eligible bachelors. Salim pointed out a disconnect between Salman’s ideal of a partner and the type of women he tends to attract.

  • Salman Khan, turning 60 soon, remains one of Bollywood's most eligible bachelors.
  • Salim Khan stated that Salman’s attraction to glamorous actresses complicates his search for a partner resembling his mother.
  • According to Salim, the discrepancy in Salman's expectations and reality contributes to his single status.
  • Salman is set to appear in the upcoming film Sikandar, releasing this March.
“There is a contradiction in Salman’s thinking, which is one of the reasons why he’s not married…” - Salim Khan

This insight sheds light on Salman Khan's prolonged bachelorhood and the complexities surrounding his relationships.

Gautam Gambhir Lagging Behind...: Coach's Every Error In Australia Tour Brutally Singled Out

Indian cricket team head coach Gautam Gambhir faces criticism after his team's losses against New Zealand and Australia. Former teammate Mohammad Kaif has pointed out several tactical errors made by Gambhir during the Australia tour.

  • Gambhir has received backlash for back-to-back Test series losses.
  • Mohammad Kaif expressed concerns over Gambhir's tactics in a viral video.
  • Kaif questioned Gambhir's decisions regarding player selections in key matches.

title: ‘Avoid panic’: Amid HMPV scare, Pune district collector calls for taking precautionary measures - The Indian Express
summary:
Pune District Collector Addresses HMPV Concerns, Urges Calm and Precautions

Publication Date: January 10, 2025 Source: The Indian Express

Pune District Collector Jitendra Dudi has reassured citizens regarding the Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV), stating that it is not a new threat and advising against panic. He emphasized the importance of basic health precautions.

  • The district saw around 20 HMPV cases in the pediatric group and 4-5 cases in adults.
  • No unusual surge in respiratory illnesses associated with HMPV has been reported in the country.
  • Dr. Aarti Kinikar noted that the last HMPV case in Pune was detected on November 28 of last year.
  • The state has increased surveillance due to an outbreak in China.
  • A total of 48,019 individuals with suspected symptoms were screened in Maharashtra recently.
“This is not a new virus and we have urged people not to panic.” - Jitendra Dudi

Health officials stress the need for calm as the situation develops; monitoring will continue to ensure public safety.
newTitle: Pune District Collector Addresses HMPV Concerns, Urges Calm and Precautions

title: Yogi Adityanath's ‘denting-painting’ warning to Waqf ahead of Maha Kumbh 2025 - Hindustan Times
summary:
Yogi Adityanath's Warning to Waqf Ahead of Maha Kumbh 2025

Date: January 10, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

The Maha Kumbh is being celebrated after 12 years, with a huge turnout of devotees expected in Prayagraj from January 13 to February 26.

  • Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath issued a warning to the Waqf Board regarding land claims ahead of the Maha Kumbh.
  • He stated that anyone wishing to claim land would face consequences, referring to 'denting-painting'.
  • Adityanath welcomed those respecting Indian traditions but criticized claims from the Waqf Board regarding land issues.
  • The statement comes after an AIMJ president's claim about land rights and entry for Muslims during the Kumbh Mela preparations.
  • No discrimination during the Maha Kumbh was promised by Adityanath, but he affirmed the reclaiming of Waqf land.
  • The event is anticipated to attract over 45 crore devotees.
“The Kumbh has been a symbol of India's heritage for thousands of years and has always taken place here.”

The Maha Kumbh 2025 is expected to be a significant event, marking a major spiritual gathering with a large influx of devotees in Prayagraj.
newTitle: Yogi Adityanath's Warning to Waqf Ahead of Maha Kumbh 2025

summary:
Who would be Narendra Modi's first call after his happiest moment? PM answers

In his first podcast appearance, Prime Minister Narendra Modi shared that his mother would have been the first person he would call during his happiest moment. He reflected on significant events in his life and emphasized the importance of family.

  • PM Modi discussed personal moments, including a pivotal call to his mother after hoisting the Indian flag at Lal Chowk in Srinagar.
  • He recalled his experience during an attack on his convoy in Punjab and the emotional significance of the call.
  • Modi talked about his childhood, political challenges, and lessons learned along the way.
  • The Prime Minister acknowledged his humanity and the inevitability of making mistakes.
“For me, it was a moment of joy and I also thought that my mother would have been worried.” - PM Narendra Modi

This podcast marks an intimate look at Modi's thoughts on family, politics, and his life experiences.

title: Sambhal mosque well row: SC orders status quo, issues notice to Centre, ASI - The Hindu
summary:
Supreme Court Orders Status Quo on Sambhal Mosque Well Dispute

Date: January 10, 2025   Source: The Hindu

In a significant ruling, the Supreme Court has ordered a status quo on the controversy surrounding a private well near the Mughal-era Jama Masjid mosque in Sambhal, Uttar Pradesh, while issuing notices to relevant authorities.

  • The Supreme Court intervened to order a status quo regarding a private well claimed by the mosque's management committee.
  • Notices were issued to the Centre, ASI, and private individuals involved in the case.
  • The dispute arose from the district administration's initiative to revive old temples and wells, which included the contested well.
  • Concerns of historical significance and potential violence surrounding the site prompted the Supreme Court's urgent intervention.
  • Previous violence related to the well had resulted in fatalities, leading to the need for judicial action.
“We have been drawing water from the well since time immemorial.” - Huzefa Ahmadi, Senior Advocate

The Supreme Court's decision highlights its role in maintaining peace and harmony amid contentious religious disputes and emphasizes the importance of ensuring due process in legal proceedings regarding historically significant sites.
newTitle: Supreme Court Orders Status Quo on Sambhal Mosque Well Dispute

title: Congress takes dig at PM Modi over ‘I'm not a God' remark in podcast with Nikhil Kamath - Hindustan Times
summary:
Congress Criticizes PM Modi for His 'I'm Not a God' Comment in Recent Podcast

Date: Jan 10, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

In a recent podcast with Zerodha co-founder Nikhil Kamath, Prime Minister Narendra Modi stated, 'I am human who can make mistakes, not some God,' prompting a reaction from the Congress party.

  • The podcast aired on YouTube, where PM Modi discussed his past as Gujarat's chief minister.
  • Congress MP Jairam Ramesh criticized Modi's comment as a form of damage control.
  • Ramesh referred to Modi's previous assertion that he was 'sent by God' before the 2024 Lok Sabha elections.

Key Remarks from PM Modi

During the podcast, he emphasized, 'Everyone makes mistakes, including me,' contrasting earlier statements where he claimed divine inspiration for his actions.

“Until my mother was alive, I used to think I was born biologically... I am convinced that I was sent by God.”

The Congress party's response highlights ongoing political tensions as the elections approach.
newTitle: Congress Criticizes PM Modi for His 'I'm Not a God' Comment in Recent Podcast

title: IIP growth rises to a six-month high of 5.2% in November - Moneycontrol
summary:
IIP Growth Reaches 5.2% in November, the Highest in Six Months

Date: January 10, 2025 | Source: Moneycontrol

The Index of Industrial Production (IIP) in India has grown by 5.2% in November, marking the highest growth rate in the last six months.

  • The core sector output expanded to a four-month high of 4.3% in November.
  • This growth is compared to the previous month's growth rate of 3.7%.
  • Continued growth indicates positive trends in industrial activity across various sectors.
“This growth signifies a recovery in industrial production post-pandemic.”

This increase in IIP reflects the resilience of the industrial sector and its importance for the overall economy.
newTitle: IIP Growth Reaches 5.2% in November, the Highest in Six Months

title: IND-W vs IRE-W Highlights, 1st ODI: India take 1-0 lead in series with six-wicket victory over hosts - The Financial Express
summary:
India Women Secure Six-Wicket Victory Over Ireland in 1st ODI

Date: 10 Jan 2025
Source: Financial Express

India Women started their tour of Ireland successfully by winning the first ODI with a six-wicket margin, chasing down Ireland’s total comfortably.

  • India Women chased down Ireland's target of 239 runs, ending at 240/4 in 34.3 overs.
  • Ireland posted 238/7 in their 50 overs, with notable contributions from Gaby Lewis (92) and Leah Paul (59).
  • Pratika Rawal top-scored for India with 89 runs, supported by Smriti Mandhana’s quick 41 and Tejal Hasabnis with an unbeaten 53.
  • Indian bowlers performed well, with Priya Mishra taking 2 wickets for 56 runs and Aimee Maguire claiming 3 for 57 for Ireland.
  • The win gave India a 1-0 lead in the series, setting up excitement for the next matches.
"India's efficient batting performance and disciplined bowling efforts were key to their victory."

Looking ahead, India aims to maintain their winning momentum in the upcoming ODI matches against Ireland.
newTitle: India Women Secure Six-Wicket Victory Over Ireland in 1st ODI

Varun Aaron Announces Retirement

Publication Date: January 25, 2025 Source: India.com

Indian cricketer Varun Aaron, known for his speed, has announced his retirement from international cricket at the age of 35, ending a promising career marred by injuries.

  • Aaron played 9 Test matches and 9 ODIs for India, taking 18 wickets in Tests and 11 wickets in ODIs.
  • His career was plagued by injuries, affecting his consistency and performance.
  • Aaron expressed gratitude to various organizations and support systems that aided his recovery and career.
  • He looks forward to exploring simple joys of life while remaining connected to cricket.
“I am excited for new challenges ahead and grateful for every moment spent on the field.” - Varun Aaron

In conclusion, Varun Aaron's retirement marks the end of an era filled with determination and talent, and he leaves a lasting legacy in Indian cricket.

title: Iron lines in the X-ray detected from a binary black hole system that can help infer their properties - Department Of Science & Technology
summary:
Iron Lines Detected from Binary Black Hole System in 4C+37.11

Publication Date: Not provided
Source: Department Of Science & Technology

This article discusses the detection of Iron Lines in X-ray from the binary black hole system in the galaxy 4C+37.11, allowing for the study of the properties of these black holes for the first time.

  • The X-ray lines help in understanding the physical conditions around black holes, including temperature and density.
  • Fe K spectral lines were detected by astronomers from the Indian Institute of Astrophysics using Chandra Space Telescope data.
  • This binary system consists of two supermassive black holes separated by 23 light years.
  • The total mass of the binary system is estimated to be 15 billion times that of the Sun.
“Detecting the Fe K line emissions from binary supermassive black holes is important for estimating the individual black hole masses and their spins.” – Mousumi Das

This study provides new insights into the dynamics of black hole systems and may have implications for understanding gravitational waves during black hole mergers.
newTitle: Iron Lines Detected from Binary Black Hole System in 4C+37.11

title: BepiColombo mission to Mercury provides new insights into planet formation - Innovation News Network
Rajiv Bajaj counters L&T Chairman's controversial ‘90-hour work week’ remark, says ‘let it start from the top’ | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Rajiv Bajaj counters L&T Chairman’s controversial ‘90-hour work week’ remark, says ‘let it start from the top’

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Live Mint

Amid ongoing controversy over L&T chairman S N Subrahmanyan's 90-hour work week remark, Rajiv Bajaj, Managing Director of Bajaj Auto, emphasized the importance of quality of work over quantity, suggesting that if a 90-hour week is to be enforced, it should start from the top management.

  • Rajiv Bajaj stated, 'Let 90 hours start from the top' during an interview with CNBC-TV18.
  • S N Subrahmanyan's comments about working on weekends sparked backlash, with many industrialists and politicians voicing their concerns.
  • Bajaj criticized the notion of long hours, advocating for improved outcomes through better leadership and empowerment of employees.
  • RPG Group’s Harsh Goenka also spoke against the excessive work hours, calling for a balanced work-life approach.
  • L&T clarified that Subrahmanyan's comments were intended to inspire extraordinary efforts for the nation's progress.
“Number of hours of work doesn’t matter, quality of work does. We need a kinder, gentler world more than ever before.” - Rajiv Bajaj

In conclusion, the discourse surrounding work hours continues to evolve, balancing productivity demands with the necessity for employee well-being.
newTitle: Rajiv Bajaj counters L&T Chairman’s controversial ‘90-hour work week’ remark, says ‘let it start from the top’

title: SENSEX, NIFTY extend losses into 3rd session on surging crude prices, FII outflows - Upstox
summary:
SENSEX, NIFTY extend losses into 3rd session on surging crude prices, FII outflows

Date: Friday, Publication Source: Not specified

Equity benchmark indices SENSEX and NIFTY faced losses for the third consecutive session due to concerns over economic growth and rising crude oil prices.

  • SENSEX dropped 241.30 points to close at 77,378.91.
  • NIFTY fell by 95 points to settle at 23,431.50.
  • Major laggards included IndusInd Bank, NTPC, and Tata Steel.
  • Tata Consultancy Services reported nearly a 6% increase in net profit.
  • FIIs sold off equities worth ₹7,170.87 crore on Thursday.
  • Global markets, including Asian and European stocks, closed lower.
“Surging crude oil prices and a strengthening dollar index contributed to the weak trend in equities.”

The persistent losses in SENSEX and NIFTY reflect broader concerns regarding economic conditions and market performance.
newTitle: SENSEX and NIFTY Continue to Decline Amid Rising Crude Prices

title: '...Not American': Justin Trudeau Fires Back At Donald Trump Over 'Canada 51st State' Jibe - Times Now
summary:
Justin Trudeau Responds to Donald Trump's 'Canada 51st State' Remarks

Publication Date: October 2023
Source: Times Now

Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau dismissed remarks from President-elect Donald Trump suggesting Canada could become the '51st State' of the United States, labeling them as a distraction tactic.

  • Trump's suggestion followed his comments regarding imposing tariffs on Canadian imports unless Ottawa enhances border security.
  • Trudeau emphasized Canadian pride and identity as distinct from being American.
  • Trump reiterated the '51st State' notion on his social media platform and criticized Canada's trade practices.
  • Amidst these remarks, Trudeau announced his resignation as Prime Minister.
“Canadians are incredibly proud of being Canadian. One of the ways we define ourselves most easily is - we are not American.” - Justin Trudeau

Despite announcing his resignation, Trudeau will remain in office until a new leader is chosen for his party.
newTitle: Justin Trudeau Responds to Donald Trump's 'Canada 51st State' Remarks

title: Rupee hits lifetime low of 85.97 vs USD amid persistent FII outflows, rising crude oil prices - Moneycontrol
summary:
Rupee hits lifetime low of 85.97 vs USD amid persistent FII outflows, rising crude oil prices

Date: January 10, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

The Indian rupee has fallen to an all-time low of 85.97 against the US dollar, affected by Foreign Institutional Investors' outflows, high oil prices, and rising US treasury yields.

  • The rupee closed at 85.9728, down from 85.8788 at open.
  • The trading range today was between 85.8638 and 85.9750 against the dollar.
  • Risk aversion has led to increased demand for the dollar amidst selling in equities.
  • Brent crude oil prices are above $78.60 per barrel, adding pressure on the rupee.
  • Expert Anil Kumar Bhansali highlights the impact of upcoming US job data on currency markets.
“Rupee closed at its weakest as risk aversion was the name of the game...” - Anil Kumar Bhansali

The decline of the rupee illustrates the challenges facing the Indian economy amidst global financial pressures, highlighting the need for strategic measures to stabilize the currency.
newTitle: Rupee Hits Record Low Amid Economic Pressures
